oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Portrait photographs
Ryman, Thomas Green, -- 1841-1904; Nashville (Tenn.) -- Biography; Ryman, Thomas Green -- Portraits
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Thomas Green Ryman, a riverboat captain and Nashville entrepreneur, built the Union Gospel Tabernacle between 1888 and 1892 at a cost of about $100,000. After Ryman's death in 1904, the Rev. Sam Jones proposed that the building's name; be changed to honor him. Afterwards, the building was known as the Ryman Auditorium. Captain Ryman was buried in Mt. Olivet Cemetery in Nashville, Tennessee, on Christmas Day 1904.
